Class dnx.jack.Behavior 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class dnx.jack.Behavior 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----dnx.jack.Behavior
public class Behavior
extends Object
The Behavior class is the abstract base for all behaviors. A behavior is any mechanism which modifies the characteristics of a Sequence. In particular, they can affect pacing, motion, appeareance and interactive behavior (or anything else you can think of).
Author:
Patrick Schmitz

fActive
Is the behavior currently active?
name
The name of the behavior, for searching, and for the tool UI

Behavior()
Constructs a default Behavior with name "Unknown".
Behavior(String)
Constructs a default Behavior with a name.

  protected String name
The name of the behavior, for searching, and for the tool UI

  protected boolean fActive
Is the behavior currently active?

Behavior 
  public Behavior()
Constructs a default Behavior with name "Unknown".
Behavior 
  public Behavior(String name)
Constructs a default Behavior with a name.

setName 
  public void setName(String name)
Sets the behavior name
getName 
  public String getName()
Returns the behavior name.
setActive 
  public void setActive(boolean fActive)
Sets the fActive flag
Parameters:
fActive - the sense to set the flag to.
isActive 
  public boolean isActive()
Returns a boolean to indicate whether the behavior is active.
getBehaviorClass 
  public abstract Class getBehaviorClass()
Returns the basic behavior class (i.e. the immediate subclass of Behavior). This is abstract, so that only a Behavior subclass can return this. Only immediate subclasses of Behavior should implement this.
getDuration 
  public abstract int getDuration()
Returns the real-time duration of the Behavior. This must be overridden by subclasses. Note that it is reasonable to return Sequence.INFINITE, for function sequences.
Returns:
real-time count of milliseconds, or Sequence.INFINITE
See Also:
INFINITE
update 
  public abstract boolean update(TimeContext tc,
                                 Sequence seq)
Requests the Behavior to update for the passed TimeContext. This method must be overridden by subclasses. Note that the time and rate will be first passed to a TimeBehavior, and so will be corrected when passed to any other Behaviors.
Parameters:
tc - the time context on the parent Sequence timeline.
seq - the Sequence upon which the Behavior acts.
Returns:
true if Behavior made any real change.
setConstraints 
  public void setConstraints(Cube viewCube,
                             Dimension seqDims)
Provides update of parent Scene dimensions, for behaviors that are based upon constraints of the Scene cube. Can be overridden by subclasses to use constraints. This is called whenever the parent Scene resizes. or when the viewCube is otherwise adjusted.
Parameters:
viewCube - the Cube that constrains the view.
seqDims - the max dimensions of the sequence
handleEvent 
  public boolean handleEvent(Event evt,
                             Sequence seq)
Handles events to the Behavior. This can be overridden by Behaviors which want to handle certain events. Note that Behaviors will get an AnimEvent.ACTIVATE_BEHAVIOR
Parameters:
evt - the Event to handle (note extensions in AnimEvent).
seq - the sequence that this behavior is associated with.
Returns:
s boolean indicating whether the event was handled
validateSequenceClass 
  public boolean validateSequenceClass(Sequence seq)
Provides an access point for Behavior classes to restrict the Sequence classes that they can be attached to. Many Behaviors can apply to anything (e.g. Time and Motion behaviors), but some make sense only in certain contexts (e.g. FrameControl only makes sense for Frame-based image sequences). If a Behavior subclass must restrict the valid sequences classes, it should override this routine, and return false for innapropriate Sequence classes.
Parameters:
seq - the sequence that this behavior is to be associated with.
Returns:
s boolean indicating whether the sequence is valid for this behavior.
toString 
  public String toString()
Provide a description of the Behavior in a String. Overrides the toString method in Object.
Overrides:
toString in class Object
save 
  public void save(PrintStream ps,
                   boolean fClose,
                   boolean fSaveMain,
                   boolean fSaveVectors,
                   String strInset)
Save a scannable version of the Behavior to a file.
Parameters:
ps - the printstream to save to
fClose - controls whether to print the closing curly bracket
fSaveMain - if true, saves info about the sequence object
fSaveVectors - if true, saves info about any vectors
strInset - the inset string (white space) to preprend to each line
scan 
  public void scan(ScanFile sf,
                   Applet aplt,
                   Component comp,
                   boolean fClose,
                   boolean fScanMain,
                   boolean fScanVectors) throws JackException
Scan the Behavior This assumes that the class name has already been scanned off.
Parameters:
sf - the ScanFile to scan from
aplt - unused here - we create no images, etc.
comp - unused here - we create no images, etc.
fClose - controls whether to scan the closing curly bracket
fScanMain - if true, scans info about the sequence object
fScanVectors - if true, scans info about any vectors
Throws: JackException
for scan errors
